enWisdom: An ignorant person is a slave to his passions
The sweetness of lust is made bitter by the shame of ignominy [and humiliation]

Wisdom: عَبْدُ الشَّهْوَةِ أَذَلُّ مِنْ عَبْدِ الرِّقِّ
enWisdom: The slave to lust is lowlier than the slave of a human being

Wisdom: عَبْدُ الشَّهْوَةِ أَسِيرٌ لَا يَنْفَكُّ أَسْرُهُ
enWisdom: The slave to lust is a prisoner who cannot be freed from his imprisonment
The comrade of lustful desires is the prisoner of [their] consequences

Wisdom: مَا رَفَعَ امْرَأً كَهِمَّتِهِ وَلَا وَضَعَهُ كَشَهْوَتِهِ  و
enWisdom: Nothing raises a person like his [earnest] endeavour and nothing lowers him like his lustful desire

Wisdom: مَغْلُوبُ الشَّهْوَةِ أَذَلُّ مِنْ مَمْلُوكِ الرِّقِّ
enWisdom: One who is overcome by lust is more abased than one who is enslaved
